questions.question: I want to know …………………………………. you don’t talk to me.
I asked him ………………………….. he was doing on my computer.
……………………….. he was taken to hospital, he could not be saved.
questions.description: Although is used to connect two contrasting ideas. Despite is not a conjunction.

questions.question: ………………………. we do not get the loan, we will have to shelve the project.
…………………………. he quits drinking, his health will not improve.
questions.description: Unless is similar to if not.

questions.question: She told me ………………………… she was going abroad.
questions.description: That is the conjunction most commonly used to introduce a noun clause.

questions.question: He worked hard …………………………… he could finish the project before the deadline.
questions.description: The conjunction so that expresses purpose.

questions.question: She smiled …………………………… she knew everything.
questions.description: All of these are possible here with different meanings.

questions.question: He asked me ………………………… I could help him.
questions.description: Either if or whether can be used to introduce an yes/no question.

questions.question: I waited and waited …………………………. they did not come.
…………………………. he was injured, he could not play.
………………………… I was the only boy in a class full of girls, I felt awkward.
questions.description: All of these words show the reason.
